==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=3|rs=金06}}

# [[silver]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[ごん]], (gon)
|kanon=[[ぎん]] (gin)
|kun=[[しろがね]] (shirogane), [[かね]] (kane)
|nanori=[[うん]] (un), [[かな]] (kana), [[かね]] (kane)
}}

====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* [[銀貨]]
* {{l|ja|銀行|tr=[[ぎんこう]], ''[[ginkō]]''}}: a bank (a financial institution)
* [[白銀]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かね}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かね}}. May be ultimately derived from [[onomatopoeia]] {{m|ja|カンカン|tr=kankan||clang clang}}, the sound of hitting metal. Compare Cantonese {{m|yue|金|tr=gam||metal, gold}}, Sanskrit {{m|sa|कनक|tr=kanaka||gold, golden}}, possibly suggesting a common onomatopoeic derivation.

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|金}}, {{l|ja|鉄}}, {{l|ja|銅}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=k|かね}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かね}}

# [[metal]]
# [[money]]

=====Usage notes=====
In former times, silver was the basis for the Japanese economy. In modern Japanese, ''kane'' is more commonly spelled using the character for {{m|en|gold}}: {{l|ja|金}}. The {{m|en|money}} sense is more commonly prefixed with {{m|ja|お|tr=o-}}.

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|しろがね|r=y}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しろがね|白|tr1=shiro|t1=white|金|tr2=kane|t2=metal}}. Starting from the [[w:Muromachi period|Muromachi Period]], the ''kane'' changes to ''gane'' due to {{rendaku|しろがね}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|acc=h|y=k|しろがね}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しろがね}}

# [[silver]]
# silver [[dust]] mixed into [[glue]] or some other [[base]]: silver [[paint]] or [[lacquer]]
# silver [[thread]]
# silver [[coin]]
# the [[color]] silver

=====Compounds=====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|銀色|しろがね いろ}}: a [[bright]] [[shining]] color, like [[silver]]
* {{ja-r|白銀蜘蛛|しろがね-ぐも}}, {{ja-r|銀蜘蛛|しろがね-ぐも}}: a type of [[spider]]
* {{ja-r|銀細工|しろがね-ざいく}}: [[finework]] using silver
* {{ja-r|銀師|しろがねし}}: a [[silverworker]], a [[silversmith]]
* {{ja-r|銀草|しろがねそう}}: alternate term for ''[[Dichocarpum stoloniferum]]'', a type of low-growing flowering plant in family ''[[Ranunculaceae]]''
* {{ja-r|銀作|しろがね-づくり}}: something [[decorated]] in silver, or made from silver
* {{ja-r|銀屋|しろがねや}}: a [[silverworker]] or [[silversmith]]'s place of business; a [[silverworker]] or [[silversmith]]; {{qualifier|archaic}} a [[moneychanger]]
{{der-bottom}}
